intro: Leucopogon confertus, commonly known as the clustered leucopogon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained, acidic soils. Leucopogon confertus is often found in coastal and inland regions of southeastern Australia.
